questions.question_text:
An organization wants to introduce a new image recognition login system.
What should the organization do to follow SRE principles?

choices.C: Avoid rolling out the new system because it may have security flaws.
choices.B: Roll out the new system to all employees to collect as much data as possible.
choices.A: Roll out the new system to a subset of employees to test it out.
choices.D: Avoid rolling out the new system because it may violate privacy policy.

discussion.content: A is correct. When implementing gradual changes, which is the third DevOps objective' SREs aim to reduce the cost of failure by rolling out changes to a small percentage of users first. Culturally, this promotes more prototyping and launching iteratively.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A - testing on a subset of users is an SRE principle

Selected Answer: A
A. Roll out the new system to a subset of employees to test it out.
A. Roll out the new system to a subset of employees to test it out.

choices.B: Inspect source code in real time without affecting user downtime.
choices.A: Implement code updates in real time without affecting the service level objective (SLO).
choices.D: Analyze live source code during user downtime.
choices.C: Manage code and accelerate application development.

questions.question_text: What does Cloud Debugger help an organization do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Cloud Debugger is a feature provided by some cloud platforms to allow developers to inspect the state of a running application in real-time without affecting its performance or users. It provides tools for capturing the state of an application at any code location in real time, without stopping or slowing it down.

B. Inspect source code in real time without affecting user downtime.
https://cloud.google.com/debugger/docs

Selected Answer: B
answer B

Selected Answer: B
Cloud Debugger is a feature of Google Cloud Platform that lets you inspect the state of an application, at any code location, without stopping or slowing down the running app. Cloud Debugger makes it easier to view the application state without adding logging statements.

Selected Answer: B
You can use Cloud Debugger with any deployment of your application, including test, development, and production. The debugger adds less than 10ms to the request latency only when the application state is captured. In most cases, this is not noticeable by users.

choices.C: By allowing users to disable two-factor authentication
choices.D: By adhering only to data polices of the country in which the head office is registered
choices.A: By automatically encrypting personally identifiable information
choices.B: By obtaining a business license to operate in a new market

Selected Answer: B
With SaaS, the cloud provider takes care of the underlying infrastructure, including hardware, networking, and software updates. The customer does not need to worry about managing or maintaining the infrastructure, allowing them to focus on using the software and meeting their business needs. This reduces the burden of IT management for the customer.

Selected Answer: B
Saas model provides flexibility without management by the customer.
B, because SaaS offers simplicity in management/oversight at the cost of flexibility.

Answer is B
Answer B

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
SaaS (Software as a Service) would be the right choice of service model if you want to minimize the level of management required by the customer. In a SaaS model, the cloud provider takes care of managing the infrastructure, platform, and software, allowing the customer to focus solely on using the software application. The provider handles tasks such as maintenance, updates, security, and scalability, relieving the customer of those responsibilities. This allows the customer to minimize their management efforts and instead concentrate on utilizing the software to meet their business needs.

Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: A
SaaS is a good choice for businesses that want to minimize the amount of IT management they need to do. With SaaS, the cloud provider takes care of all of the software maintenance, updates, and security. This frees up businesses to focus on their core competencies.
However, SaaS is not as flexible as IaaS or PaaS. With SaaS, businesses are limited to the features and functionality that are provided by the cloud provider. If a business needs a specific feature that is not offered by the SaaS provider, they will need to find a different solution.
Overall, SaaS is a good choice for businesses that want a balance between flexibility and management

choices.B: You want to minimize the level of management by the customer
choices.D: You want to be able to shift your emphasis between flexibility and management by the cloud provider as business needs change
choices.C: You want to maximize flexibility for the customer.
choices.A: You want a balance between flexibility for the customer and the level of management by the cloud provider

questions.question_text:
Each of the three cloud service models - infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), and software as a service (SaaS) - offers benefits between flexibility and levels of management by the cloud provider and the customer.
Why would SaaS be the right choice of service model?
